Incidents.IncidentDescription: We're currently experiencing issues related to GitHub Actions not running due to a hidden non-payment of $0 in the GitHub Actions usage, which we couldn't solve ourselves without relying on GitHub Support who didn't answer our query yet. As a result, all releases and website updates were stopped.

IncidentTimeline.TimelineDescription: The releases are now back up and running thanks to GitLab CI/CD workflows!
We've managed to fix the main website deployment workflow by migrating the deployment operation to GitLab while updating GitHub's branch with the gh-pages branch!
We've managed to get the Terminaux API doc to build again from GitLab!

Incidents.IncidentDescription: We're currently experiencing problems getting a list of ISP mail information for the automatic mail configuration detection feature on Nettify.

IncidentTimeline.TimelineDescription: We are currently making changes to Nettify to better utilize Thunderbird's resources by using submodules instead of "web scraping."
We have started development of Nettify v1.5.5.2 that fixes this problem in future canary builds.
We've released 1.5.5.2, and it will be available to NuGet soon.
We have resolved the incident, and the Nettify development branch should work again. To the Thunderbird team, we'll make an apology post in our blog soon; we are very sorry about this.

Incidents.IncidentName: All projects - API documentation not updated for over a month
Incidents.IncidentDescription: We're experiencing issues updating the API documentation due to GitHub workflows not working in our organization.

IncidentTimeline.TimelineDescription: We've confirmed that the issue lies on GitHub workflows not working.
We've managed to fix the situation with Terminaux 7.0 as we're getting closer to the final release! The rollout will start soon.
